intro: Eriocephalus eximius, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, typical of the family. Its leaves are silver-white on the underside, giving it a distinctive appearance. Eriocephalus eximius is often found in open, sunny habitats and is known for its ornamental value.
